dashboard.scriptTagNotice: ScriptTag capability on Thank you / Order status pages relates to the {date} (Plus merchants) deprecation (Shopify Jan 2025). Use the Migration page checklist and Verification page report to complete migration and ensure smooth tracking transition.

backendUrl.errorTitle: Critical error: BACKEND_URL was not replaced at build time
backendUrl.detected: Placeholder __BACKEND_URL_PLACEHOLDER__ detected; URL was not replaced at build
backendUrl.description: Pixel extension config still contains the placeholder; the build did not replace it. If not replaced, the pixel extension cannot send events to the backend and events will be lost. This is a critical config error and must be fixed before launch.
backendUrl.fixSteps: Fix steps (must be done before production deploy):
backendUrl.step1: In CI/CD, run pnpm ext:inject or pnpm deploy:ext before deploy
backendUrl.step3: Verify extension build output no longer contains the placeholder
backendUrl.step4: Ensure the URL is configured in Web Pixel Extension allowlist
backendUrl.step5: Do not use shopify app deploy directly; use pnpm deploy:ext

dashboard.welcomeBannerDesc: Start your migration: scan risk → configure migration → verify test → generate report
dashboard.quickStartDesc: Complete the steps below to start migration
dashboard.pixelMigrationDesc: Standard event mapping + param completeness + downloadable payload evidence (GA4/Meta/TikTok)
dashboard.pixelMigrationTech: Technical note: Web Pixel runs in strict sandbox (Web Worker), many capabilities are limited
dashboard.thankYouOrderDesc: Migrate tracking to Web Pixel; use verification report for delivery validation. This app does not provide Thank you/Order status page module library.
dashboard.verificationReportDesc: Test checklist + event param completeness + order amount/currency consistency + privacy compliance (consent/customerPrivacy) • Evidence for stakeholders
dashboard.reportCenterDesc: Manage Audit / Verification / Monitoring report export and history.

dataConnection.messageNoIngestion: Data connection incomplete: configure Ingestion Key.
dataConnection.messageNoPixel: Data connection incomplete: Web Pixel needs to be installed.
dataConnection.messagePixelNoKey: Data connection incomplete: Web Pixel config missing ingestion_key. Please re-sync config.

errors.genericMessage: The system encountered an unexpected issue. Please try again later.

errors.loadError: An error occurred while loading the page.

privacy.title: Privacy & data
privacy.subtitle: Learn how this app collects, uses, and protects your store data
privacy.dataOverviewP1: Tracking Guardian acts as a Data Processor on behalf of merchants (data controllers) to process conversion tracking data. We follow GDPR, CCPA and other privacy regulations to ensure data security and compliance.
privacy.dataOverviewP2: This app does not rely on customer PII; core features (event verification, monitoring, migration suggestions) remain available even when Shopify redacts PII to null.
privacy.pixelEventDataDesc: From Web Pixel event receipts, for diagnostics and statistics
pixelEventDataItems: Event parameters (e.g. order amount, currency, product info)
Checkout token (for matching pixel events, hashed)
privacy.requestTechDataDesc: For security, anti-fraud and verification we may store request-related technical data (e.g. IP, User-Agent, page_url, referrer). Retention follows store data retention; deletion follows GDPR/webhook policy.
privacy.conversionTrackingDesc: v1 is based only on Web Pixel customer events and pixel receipts (PixelEventReceipt); we do not read orders via Admin API, do not subscribe to order webhooks, and do not send server-side events to third parties.
privacy.importantNoServerDelivery: Important: current version does not offer server-side delivery
privacy.noServerDeliveryDesc: Server-side delivery to ad platforms is off by default; focus is client pixels and verification reconciliation. This version only receives and validates Web Pixel events for in-app diagnostics and verification.
privacy.reconciliationDesc: v1 is based only on Web Pixel events and pixel receipts; we do not read orders via Admin API. We compare pixel event receipts with internal logs to help you find tracking gaps and optimize configuration.
privacy.complianceDesc: Based on customer consent state, we automatically decide whether to send data to specific platforms, ensuring GDPR/CCPA compliance.
privacy.whenSentDesc: When a visitor triggers Shopify standard events (e.g. checkout_completed, page_viewed, product_viewed, checkout_started) during checkout or browsing, this app's Web Pixel sends events to our backend; only when the customer has granted the relevant consent (analytics or marketing per event type) via Customer Privacy API.
privacy.fieldsSentDesc: Only event type, timestamp, store domain, and order/checkout-related non-PII (e.g. orderId, checkoutToken, amount, currency, product ID/quantity). No customer name, email, phone, address or other PII.
privacy.consentChangesDesc: This Pixel declares and relies on Shopify Customer Privacy API (analytics, marketing). We subscribe to visitorConsentCollected; when the merchant updates consent settings or the visitor changes their choice, the Pixel updates internal consent state; events are not sent to the backend when consent is not granted.
privacy.notificationsDesc: In the current version, alert notifications are disabled. The following services are only used in future versions or when the merchant explicitly enables alerts:
privacy.slackDesc: Slack Webhook: sends JSON alert data (store domain, alert type, aggregated metrics, report link). Merchant-level data only; no order details or end-customer information.
privacy.telegramDesc: Telegram Bot API: sends store-level alert summaries and metrics. No order details or end-customer information.
privacy.dataRetentionIntro: We follow data minimization and regularly clean expired data.
privacy.pixelReceiptRetention: Per store data retention (default 90 days), for pixel event matching and verification.
privacy.verificationRunRetention: Per store data retention (default 90 days), for verification reports and history.
privacy.scanReportRetention: Per store data retention (default 90 days), for migration audit and risk list.
privacy.eventAuditLogRetention: Per store data retention (default 90 days); audit logs at least 180 days or the greater value, for troubleshooting and compliance audit.
privacy.dataDeletionIntro: We support multiple deletion methods so you can control your data at any time:
privacy.uninstallDesc: When you uninstall the app we receive Shopify's APP_UNINSTALLED webhook and delete all data associated with your store within 48 hours.
privacy.gdprCustomerDesc: When a customer requests deletion via Shopify we receive CUSTOMERS_DATA_REQUEST or CUSTOMERS_REDACT webhook and delete the relevant data.
privacy.shopDeletionDesc: We respond to SHOP_REDACT webhook and delete all shop data.
privacy.transportEncryptionDesc: All API communication uses TLS 1.2+ encryption.
privacy.credentialEncryptionDesc: Platform API keys (Meta Access Token, TikTok Pixel Code, etc.) are stored with AES-256-GCM encryption.
privacy.accessControlDesc: Verified via Shopify OAuth; only authorized store admins can access data.
privacy.gdprWebhooksIntro: Shopify requires apps to correctly respond to mandatory GDPR webhooks. Testing steps:
privacy.gdprStep1: Find your app in Shopify Partners Dashboard
privacy.gdprStep1Desc: Go to App setup → GDPR Mandatory webhooks
privacy.gdprStep2Desc: Ensure the following endpoints are configured:
privacy.gdprStep3Desc: Run the following command to trigger a test webhook:
privacy.gdprImplemented: This app implements all GDPR mandatory webhook handlers. See app/webhooks/handlers/ directory.
privacy.exportDeleteIntro: Under GDPR and CCPA you have the right to export or delete your data. We provide:
privacy.dataExportDesc: Export all your store data, including conversion records, event logs, survey responses, etc.
privacy.exportNote: Files download in the browser. Large datasets may take a few minutes.
privacy.dataDeletionDesc: Delete all your store data. This action cannot be undone; proceed with caution.
privacy.deleteWarning: Warning: deletion permanently removes all data, including:
privacy.confirmDeleteQuestion: Are you sure you want to delete all data? This will permanently remove:
privacy.gdprRequestStatusDesc: View recent GDPR data and deletion request status.
privacy.deleteFeatureUnavailable: Delete feature requires backend support; contact admin or use GDPR webhook.

scan.introManualDesc: Add Additional Scripts that Shopify API cannot read; ensure report covers Thank you / Order status.
introManualItems: Generate full migration checklist and risk grading
scan.introChecklistDesc: View risk grading, recommended migration paths and estimated effort as delivery checklist.
scan.introAutoDesc: Auto-scan ScriptTags and Web Pixels; generate migration risk assessment and recommendations.
introAutoItems: Detect installed pixels and platform signals
Output migration path and effort suggestions

scan.selectPlatformOrFeature: Please select at least one platform or feature

pixels.pixelMigrationDesc: Complete pixel migration, test and rollback with templated flow; ensure event mapping and param completeness.

reports.title: Report center
reports.subtitle: View and export scan reports, verification reports
reports.description: Go to Scan or Verification page for details; export scan report and verification report (CSV export requires Growth plan or above).

Verification report: after running verification on Verification page, export verification report CSV
reports.shopNotFound: Shop not found; ensure the app is installed correctly.
reports.scanReportDesc: After auto or manual scan on Audit page, export scan report (CSV) here. Export requires Growth plan or above.
reports.verificationReportDesc: After running verification on Verification page, export the latest verification report (CSV) here or on Verification page. Export requires Growth plan or above.
reports.goToVerificationPage: Go to Verification page to run verification

migrate.pageSubtitle: Full flow from Legacy Checkout to Checkout Extensibility
migrate.noShopHint: Ensure the app is installed correctly.
migrate.introDesc: Complete the steps below to migrate from Legacy Checkout to Checkout Extensibility
introItems: Scan existing tracking scripts and assess risk
Configure Web Pixel and event mapping
Add this app blocks on checkout and Order status pages
migrate.backendUrlBannerP1: Before production deploy, ensure BACKEND_URL is correctly injected into the extension config. If the placeholder is not replaced, the pixel extension cannot send events to the backend and events will be lost.
migrate.backendUrlStep1: In CI/CD, run pnpm ext:inject or pnpm deploy:ext before deploy
migrate.backendUrlStep3: After deploy, verify the URL in the extension config is injected (not placeholder)
migrate.backendUrlTip: If the placeholder is not replaced, the pixel extension will silently disable event sending with no error. This is a common cause of event loss; fix before production deploy.
migrate.strictSandboxP1: Web Pixel runs in a strict sandbox (Web Worker). The following are limited:
migrate.strictSandboxNoDom: No access to DOM, localStorage, third-party cookies, etc.
migrate.strictSandboxNullFields: Some event fields may be null or undefined (e.g. buyer.email, buyer.phone, deliveryAddress); this is a platform limit, not a bug.
migrate.strictSandboxWebhooks: Some event types (refund, order_cancelled, order_edited, etc.) are not available in strict sandbox; use order webhooks.
migrate.strictSandboxTip: This is a Shopify platform design limit, not an app bug. The verification report will mark fields and events unavailable due to strict sandbox.
migrate.step1Desc: Auto-scan tracking scripts in the store; generate migration checklist and risk report
migrate.step2Desc: Create Web Pixel; configure event mapping and platform credentials
migrate.step3Desc: Add this app blocks for Thank you and Order status in Shopify checkout and customer account editor
migrate.step4Desc: Run verification tests; generate report; set up gap alerts
migrate.orderStatusBannerTitle: Order status block requires Customer Account
migrate.orderStatusBannerDesc: The Order status block requires the store to have Customer Account or Checkout API enabled; otherwise it may not be visible. Enable in Shopify admin.
migrate.listItem1: Open checkout or customer account editor
migrate.listItem2: Add this app block on Thank you page
migrate.listItem3: Add this app block on Order status page
migrate.migrationCompleteDesc: You have completed all migration steps. Run verification regularly to keep tracking stable.
migrate.step1DetailDesc: Auto-scan ScriptTags and Web Pixels; manually paste to identify Additional Scripts; generate migration checklist and risk report. Free; helps you see what to migrate.
migrate.step2DetailDesc: Create Web Pixel Extension; configure event mapping (Shopify standard events → platform events); set platform credentials (GA4/Meta/TikTok). Requires Starter ($29/mo) or above.
migrate.step3DetailDesc: In Shopify checkout settings or theme editor, open checkout/customer account customizer; add this app blocks on Thank you and Order status pages; save and publish. Order status block requires Customer Account or Checkout API; see step card above.
migrate.step4DetailDesc: Run verification to validate event firing and param completeness; generate deliverable report (CSV); set gap alerts. Report export requires Growth ($79/mo) or Agency ($199/mo).
migrate.shopifyDeadlineDesc: The dates below are from Shopify announcements; for actual deadlines check Shopify Admin. Shopify may update policy; check official docs regularly.
migrate.plusDeadline: Plus stores: auto-upgrade from 2026-01 (legacy customizations will be lost)
migrate.migrateEarly: Complete migration early to avoid last-minute rush.

verification.pageSubtitle: Test checklist + event trigger log + parameter completeness + order amount/currency consistency • Privacy compliance (consent/customerPrivacy) • CSV export is a core paid feature • Growth $79/mo or Agency $199/mo
verification.noShopHint: Ensure the app is installed correctly.
verification.introDesc: Validate event triggers and parameter completeness via test checklist; deliver verification report.
verification.bannerFailedItem2: Events actually fire in checkout funnel
verification.bannerFailedItem3: No ad blocker or browser policy blocking requests
verification.bannerPartialDesc: Some events lack required params (e.g. value or currency), which may affect attribution. Check order data.
verification.bannerSuccessDesc: Your tracking is working. Run verification regularly to stay stable.
verification.localConsistencyDesc: Deep consistency check on order data; Pixel vs reconciliation.
verification.localBannerInconsistentDesc: Some orders have key param mismatches (amount, currency, duplicate event ID). Check config.
verification.localBannerPartialDesc: Some orders have partial param mismatches; may affect tracking accuracy.
verification.moreOrders: {count} more order details; see full results or export report
verification.scopeBannerP1: This app verifies event firing and data quality; we do not guarantee platform attribution alignment.
verification.weProvide: We provide: event trigger log, parameter completeness, order amount/currency consistency as verification evidence.
verification.weDontGuarantee: We do not guarantee: platform report attribution matches Shopify order data. Attribution is affected by platform algorithm, privacy, cross-device limits, delay, etc.
verification.reportNote: If verification shows Pass, pixel events are received and validated in-app; platform attribution may still differ.
verification.emptyDesc: Complete a test order per the guide above, then click Run verification to analyze.
verification.emptyHelp: Verification uses events from the last 24 hours to validate tracking.
verification.itemFailed: Test item "{name}" failed; check event firing

monitoring.title: Gap monitoring & alerts
monitoring.description: View recent alerts, event success rate and loss stats; configure alert channel and thresholds in Settings.
items: Alert list: alerts triggered in last 30 days
Last 7 days conversion and success rate summary
Last 24h event loss and success rate

settings.introDesc: Configure security & privacy policy and subscription plan.
introItems: Subscription & billing: configure in Subscription tab or go to Billing page
Data retention & privacy in Security & privacy tab
Privacy policy & GDPR requests on Privacy page
settings.quickAccessDesc: Access the following via the left nav or buttons below.
settings.billingManagementDesc: Manage your subscription, view billing history, upgrade or downgrade. View current plan in the Subscription tab or go to Billing for more.
settings.pageModulesDesc: This app provides UI extensions on Thank you and Order status pages. Add and enable this app blocks in Shopify Checkout and accounts editor.
settings.statusNotPlus: Requires Shopify Plus or eligible plan
settings.statusNoEditorAccess: Requires Checkout and accounts editor access
settings.alertsDisabledDesc: Outbound notifications (Slack/Telegram/Email) are disabled in this version; only in-app alert records apply. Contact support or wait for a future release to enable.
settings.alertsConfigDesc: Configure alert channels and thresholds; alerts are recorded when gaps or anomalies trigger and can be viewed on the Monitoring page.
settings.billingInfoDescAfter: page for full billing history, usage stats and invoices.
settings.needHelpChoose: Need help choosing a plan? Contact our sales team for personalized advice.
settings.securityDesc: Manage Pixel event association token and data security.
settings.ingestionKeyDesc: Used to associate event requests from Web Pixel. This token helps:
settings.ingestionKeyBullets: Filter misconfigured or invalid requests; associate pixel events with orders; identify request source in multi-store scenarios.
settings.ingestionKeyCaution: Important: this token is visible in browser network requests; it is not a strong security boundary. Security is provided by multiple layers.
settings.reinstallOrGenerate: Reinstall the app or click Generate token
settings.relaxedDesc: Non-allowlisted/HMAC failure may still be accepted
settings.rotateModalBody: After rotation Web Pixel will auto-update; ensure relevant members are notified.
settings.generateModalBody: After generation it will be auto-configured to Web Pixel.
settings.ingestionKeyBullet3: Identify request source in multi-store scenarios
settings.ingestionKeyOrigin: Only accept requests from Shopify checkout (Referer/ShopDomain fallback; fallback usage logged in production)
settings.ingestionKeyHmac: HMAC for integrity and basic abuse resistance (key visible to client; authenticity relies on webhook/order reconciliation)
settings.ingestionKeyDataMin: We do not collect, process, or send end-customer PII (including hashes)
settings.securityBoundaryNote: This token is mainly for event association and diagnostics; do not treat it as a strong credential. Security is provided by webhook/order reconciliation and architecture.
settings.integrityKeyNote: ingestion_key is an integrity key, not a secret; it is sent to the client. Used for integrity and basic abuse resistance; true security is from webhook/order reconciliation.
settings.relaxedModeCaution: Requests from non-allowlisted origins or with HMAC failure may still be accepted and marked low-trust, affecting report accuracy. For higher accuracy, set PIXEL_STRICT_ORIGIN=true and configure Origin allowlist.
settings.oldTokenValid: Old token still valid: previous token will expire at {date}. Until then both old and new tokens work for a smooth transition.
settings.graceWindowEnd: After the grace period, the old token will expire and only the new token will be accepted.
settings.oldTokenExpired: Old token expired: previous token has been cleared; only the new token is accepted.
settings.hmacMonitorDesc: Monitor key rotation and suspicious activity. Check this panel regularly.
settings.graceWindowActive: Grace period: old key will expire at {date}
settings.suggestRotate: Recommendation: rotate key regularly for security
settings.suggestRotateDesc: No rotation detected yet. Recommend rotating every 90 days. Click Rotate now to start.
settings.rotateTip: After rotation, the new key is synced to Web Pixel config; old key expires in 30 minutes.
settings.rotateWarning: ingestion_key is a weak secret sent to the client. After rotation, check event reception; if you suspect leakage, rotate immediately and check logs.
settings.keyRotated90Days: Key has not been rotated for 90+ days
settings.lastRotationDaysAgo: Last rotation: {date} ({days} days ago). Recommend rotating regularly. Click Rotate now.
settings.highSuspiciousBannerTitle: ⚠️ High volume of suspicious activity detected – take action immediately
settings.highSuspiciousBannerDesc: System detected {count} suspicious activities, which may include invalid signatures or abnormal origin requests. This may indicate key leakage or injection attempts.
settings.highSuspiciousItem1: Rotate key immediately (click Rotate now above or Rotate token button)
settings.highSuspiciousItem2: Check access logs and event receipt records; review abnormal request sources
settings.highSuspiciousItem3: If key leakage is suspected, rotate token immediately and check event logs
settings.highSuspiciousItem4: Review for abnormal origin requests or injection attempts
settings.highSuspiciousItem5: Check "Event loss rate" on the monitoring page for abnormal event loss
settings.mediumSuspiciousBannerDesc: System detected {count} suspicious activities. Recommend checking access logs regularly; consider rotating key if activity continues to increase.
settings.mediumSuspiciousBannerTip: If invalid signature count keeps increasing, it may be an early sign of key leakage. Recommend rotating key during the next maintenance window.
settings.noSuspiciousBanner: ✅ No suspicious activity detected in the last 24 hours; system is running normally
settings.noTokenBannerTitle: ⚠️ Association token not configured: generate token to enable pixel event integrity verification
settings.noTokenBannerDesc: Without a token, pixel events can still be received but integrity signals and association capability are reduced. Click Generate token above to create a new token.
settings.p0SecurityBannerTitle: ⚠️ P0 security notice: PIXEL_ALLOW_NULL_ORIGIN_WITH_SIGNATURE_ONLY and ingestionKey management
settings.p0SecuritySandbox: Some Shopify Web Worker sandbox environments may send Origin: null; if you need to accept such events, set to true.
settings.p0SecurityFalse: If set to false, requests with Origin: null will be rejected and events may be lost.
settings.p0SecurityVisibilityBullet1: ingestion_key is delivered to the pixel client and is a public signal; do not treat it as a strong auth credential.
settings.p0SecurityVisibilityBullet2: Null origin requests cannot rely on Origin verification; HMAC is for integrity and anti-noise only.
settings.p0SecurityVisibilityBullet3: True order and conversion authenticity should be verified via Shopify webhook/order reconciliation.
settings.p0SecurityMeasure1: Rotate ingestionKey regularly (recommend every 90 days; use Rotate token above)
settings.p0SecurityMeasure2: Monitor abnormal event reception (check event stats in Dashboard, especially null origin requests)
settings.p0SecurityMeasure3: When null origin requests spike, logs record [SECURITY] Null origin request spike; monitor logs.
settings.p0SecurityMeasure4: If abuse is suspected, rotate token immediately and check event logs and access records
settings.p0SecurityMeasure5: PIXEL_ALLOW_NULL_ORIGIN_WITH_SIGNATURE_ONLY is optional: default allows signed Origin:null/missing; set false to reject such requests.
settings.p0SecurityMeasure6: Use token rotation (old token has 30-minute grace period for smooth transition)
settings.p0SecurityMeasure7: Record and audit token rotation; maintain runbooks
settings.p0SecurityMeasure8: Establish token expiry (system supports previousIngestionSecret and previousSecretExpiry; recommend regular rotation)
settings.p0SecurityRotationNote: Token rotation: on rotate, the system saves the old token as previousIngestionSecret and accepts both old and new for 30 minutes so Web Pixel config can update without losing events. After the grace period, the old token expires. If abuse is found, rotate immediately; the system syncs the new token to Web Pixel config. After rotation, check event logs to confirm the new token works.
settings.howItWorksP1: The server records this token and uses it for integrity signals. Missing or wrong tokens do not block reception but lower event trust. After rotation, App Pixel auto-updates; the old token has a 30-minute grace period.
settings.howItWorksBullet1: On rotate, the old token is saved as previousIngestionSecret
settings.howItWorksBullet2: The old token remains valid for 30 minutes for a smooth transition
settings.howItWorksBullet3: After the grace period, the old token expires
settings.howItWorksBullet4: The system syncs the new token to Web Pixel config
settings.dataRetentionDesc: Configure how long conversion logs and related records are stored.
settings.dataRetentionHelpText: Data older than this will be automatically deleted
settings.dataRetentionNoteP1: The following are subject to retention; after the period they are deleted:
settings.dataRetentionPixelReceipt: Pixel event receipts (PixelEventReceipt): client consent evidence
settings.dataRetentionDeadLetter: Failed tasks (dead_letter): conversion tasks that cannot be retried
settings.dataRetentionCleanup: Cleanup runs daily. Audit logs are retained 365 days and are not affected by this setting.
settings.dataMinimizationP1: We only store data needed for conversion tracking:
settings.dataMinimizationBullets: Order ID, amount, currency, product info (from Webhook); consent status, event timestamp (from Pixel)
settings.dataMinimizationPii: About PII (email, phone, etc.): We do not store customer PII (name, email, phone, address). We only store irreversible hashes when needed for pixel dedup or diagnostics. The current public version does not read order details from Shopify nor access Protected Customer Data (PCD). We do not request read_orders or subscribe to order webhooks. If we add order-based verification/reconciliation or repurchase features later, we will enable them after PCD approval and update privacy/compliance docs.
settings.pixelPrivacyDesc: Understand pixel load policy, backend filtering, and why some platform events may be filtered.
settings.pixelLoadPolicyP1: Web Pixel Extension load conditions (configured in shopify.extension.toml):
settings.pixelLoadPolicyBullets: analytics = true: pixel loads only with analytics consent (for GA4 etc.) • marketing = true: pixel loads only with marketing consent (for Meta/TikTok) • sale_of_data = "disabled": sale of data consent not required
settings.pixelLoadPolicyNote: Current manifest requires analytics or marketing consent to load (analytics = true, marketing = true). So when the customer grants analytics or marketing consent, the pixel loads; if neither is granted, it does not. Event send requires analytics or marketing consent (code checks hasAnalyticsConsent() || hasMarketingConsent()). Backend further filters by platform: GA4 (analytics consent) and Meta/TikTok (marketing consent; if customer only granted analytics, those platform events are filtered server-side) for compliance.
settings.backendFilterP1: Backend further filters events by platform compliance:
settings.backendFilterBullets: GA4 (Google Analytics): analytics consent only • Meta (Facebook/Instagram): marketing consent; do not send when customer explicitly refuses saleOfData • TikTok: marketing consent; do not send when customer explicitly refuses saleOfData
settings.backendFilterWhy: Why: Better coverage (analytics-only users still get GA4) • Compliance (Meta/TikTok still strictly checked) • Consistency: pixel load condition ≤ backend send condition (when pixel loads, at least GA4 can send)
settings.actualEffectBullets: Analytics only: pixel loads, GA4 receives, Meta/TikTok do not • Marketing only: pixel loads, Meta/TikTok receive, GA4 may receive (per backend) • Both: pixel loads, all configured platforms receive
settings.actualEffectNote: Backend further filters by platform for GDPR/CCPA etc. In Dashboard you can see per-platform send stats and filter reasons.
settings.viewFilterStatsP1: On the Dashboard monitoring page you can see: event send success rate per platform • count of events filtered by consent • consent rate stats per platform
settings.consentStrategyDesc: Control how events are filtered in verification and internal processing. Different strategies suit different regions.
settings.consentHelpStrict: Requires trusted pixel receipt + explicit consent to send. For GDPR/CCPA etc. Recommended.
settings.consentHelpBalanced: Still requires pixel receipt and explicit consent; allows sending when receipt trust is partial (slightly looser than strict).
settings.strictModeDesc: Current version only receives and validates Web Pixel events; no server-side delivery.
settings.balancedModeDesc: Still requires pixel receipt and explicit consent, but allows "partially trusted" receipts. Looser than strict but ensures user consent evidence before sending.
settings.balancedModeSuggestion: If most customers are from EU/UK etc., we recommend strict.
settings.unknownStrategyDesc: Current strategy is invalid; system will treat as strict. Please select a valid strategy.
settings.consentModalBody1: Balanced still requires pixel receipt and explicit consent, but allows "partially trusted" receipts (trust=partial).
settings.consentModalBody2: For GDPR and similar strict regions, we recommend strict. Are you sure you want to switch?
settings.rotateRiskP1: ingestion_key is a weak secret delivered to the client. After rotation:
settings.rotateRiskBullet1: Compare event reception to check for lost events
settings.rotateRiskBullet2: Confirm Web Pixel config has auto-updated
settings.rotateRiskBullet3: If leakage is suspected, rotate immediately and check event logs
settings.rotateRiskBullet4: Old key expires in 30 minutes for a smooth transition

onboarding.pageSubtitle: Upgrade without losing features/data • Deliverable verification report • Post-launch gap alerts
onboarding.shopLoadFailed: Shop failed to load; please refresh and try again.
onboarding.autoScanDesc: We will auto-scan ScriptTags and Web Pixels; Additional Scripts need manual paste to identify. We identify scripts to migrate and assess risk.
onboarding.acknowledgeScan: I understand the scan will not change any shop settings
onboarding.estimateDesc1: Your setup is simple; migration will be quick. We recommend completing all steps in one go.
onboarding.estimateDesc2: Standard flow; follow the steps. Allow about 1 hour for migration and testing.
onboarding.estimateDesc3: Multiple platforms or complex config may take longer. We recommend 2–3 phases with testing between.
onboarding.estimateDesc4: Setup is more complex; migrate in phases. Prioritize high-risk items and verify each step before continuing.
onboarding.scanningProgress: This usually takes 10–30 seconds; please do not close the page.

support.title: Support
support.subtitle: Help center
support.supportDesc: Get support for migration, pixels, and verification via tickets and FAQ. Current version focuses on migration and verification; server-side conversion delivery is optional/future, off by default.
